meanings.definition: The act or process of breaking down into simpler components.
meanings.sent1: The decompositions of the food in the compost bin help create rich soil.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the decompositions of various substances to understand their properties.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with laughter as the students acted out the decompositions of complex words.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the decompositions of colors can evoke different emotions in viewers.
meanings.sent5: The slow decompositions of fallen leaves on the forest floor provide nutrients for new plant growth.

meanings.definition: The state of being broken down into simpler components.
meanings.sent1: The decompositions of the old building revealed hidden architectural details.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the decompositions of organic matter contribute to the cycle of life.
meanings.sent3: The detective's investigation led to the surprising decompositions of the mysterious case.
meanings.sent4: The decompositions of society's norms can lead to cultural shifts and changes.
meanings.sent5: The gradual decompositions of the rock formations exposed layers of geological history.
